intro: Nemesia cheiranthus, commonly known as the common nemesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Nemesia cheiranthus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
